Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Texas did not bail out the loan program.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the success of the loan program by stating that it worked as intended.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent of the problems and defaults in the loan program.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in accurately representing the performance and management of the loan program.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to prove that Texas did not bail out the loan program.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the loan program was successful and did not require a bailout.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may not consider alternative explanations for the problems and defaults in the loan program.
